title: HTML JavaScript
gp1: JavaScript makes HTML pages more dynamic and interactive.
gp2: The HTML <script> tag is used to define a client-side script (JavaScript).
gp3: The <script> element either contains script statements, or it points to an external script file through the src attribute.
gp4: Common uses for JavaScript are image manipulation, form validation, and dynamic changes of content.
gp5: To select an HTML element, JavaScript most often uses the document.getElementById() method.
gp6: This JavaScript example writes 'Hello JavaScript!' into an HTML element with id='demo':
wp1: The HTML <noscript> tag defines an alternate content to be displayed to users that have disabled scripts in their browser or have a browser that doesn't support scripts:
wp3: <noscript> ==> Defines an alternate content for users that do not support client-side scripts
example:
<script>
document.getElementById( 'demo' ).innerHTML = 'Hello JavaScript!';
</script>
<noscript>Sorry, your browser does not support JavaScript!</noscript>
